The 'Bar-tailed Godwit' (Limosa lapponica) is a large wader in the family
Scolopacidae, which breeds on Arctic coasts and tundra mainly in the Old World,
and winters on coasts in temperate and tropical regions of the Old World. del Hoyo, J., Elliott, A., & Sargatal, J., eds. (1996). Handbook of the
Birds of the World Vol. 3. Lynx Edicions, Barcelona ISBN 84-87334-15-6.
Its migration is the longest known non-stop flight of any bird and also the
longest journey without pausing to feed by any animal.
